derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: perhaps from Old French pole 'chicken' + cat

entry.def: A polecat is a small, thin, fierce wild animal. Polecats have a very unpleasant smell.

means.word_mean: 1. American musteline mammal typically ejecting an intensely malodorous fluid when startled; in some classifications put in a separate subfamily Mephitinae
2. dark brown mustelid of woodlands of Eurasia that gives off an unpleasant odor when threatened

auth_sentence.content: The European polecat feeds on small rodents, birds, amphibians and reptiles.
auth_sentence.res_content: The European polecat feeds on small rodents, birds, amphibians and reptiles.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The European polecat feeds on small rodents, birds, amphibians and reptiles.
